reviews.text: We were looking for a nice, comfortable, clean hotel with a personality that could accommodate a family with children and not break the bank. Hotel Eder did not disappoint! I can only reiterate what others have already said about its convenient location, helpful staff, cleanliness and value for the money. Personally, I much prefer this type of hotel with more of a friendly personalized service and comfortable local atmosphere than a larger chain hotel. Overall, I think it was perfect for our family and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: It was conveniently situated in a quiet side street close to the main railway station, and a short walk to Karlplatz and onto Marienplatz. The underground was very close as well. Very convenient for food. Well situated to any day tours departing from either the station or Karlstadt. The hotel was very clean and the staff all very friendly and helpful, they gave us directions to a laundry which although was a bit of a walk was still convenient for us. The breakfasts were very good, gave you a good start to the day. There is no lift in the building so it was a bit of a trek up the four flights of stairs with heavy bags, not that this deterred from the whole ambiance of this lovely hotel. We had a triple room which was perfect for us, a lovely clean bathroom. We would definately stay here again and recommend to friends.
reviews.title: Great family run hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is located within the city area, walking distance to the pedestrian streets for shopping. Parking is close by, food are found round the corners. The room is super as there are beds for all 4 of us and still plenty of space for us to walk about. The counter staff is great, They help to guide us to places for shopping and meals. On the last day, they even print out a copy on the GPS direction to the airport. The breakfast is great and have good choices.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I decided to try out a locally family run hotel and chose Hotel Eder because of the proximity to the central train station (Hauptbahnhof). If you get off at the right exit, it is less than a 5 min walk to the hotel. At first, I thought that the hotel would be quite loud because of the several casinos located in this area included one just down the street from it but it wasn't loud at well. Check-in was pretty easy and my room was located past the breakfast area and into the other building. Because of reading Tripadvisor, I was prepared to walk up the two flights of stairs. Room looks just like in the pictures. Pretty basic and clean but without all of the frills (wi-fi is free - just ask for the password at the desk). The room was pretty warm so it was nice that the windows opened to get some fresh air in. Breakfast, which was included, is your traditional European breakfast - coffee / juice, cold cuts, cheese, yogurt, bread / pastries, etc. When you leave the hotel, this is also the type of place where you leave your room key at the front desk. I was glad that they asked for a name when I came back that night. If you don't mind a hotel without an elevator, I would definitely recommend this place.
reviews.title: Nice family run hotel

reviews.text: Actually stayed here December 2011 with husband and 11 year old daughter ( I've taken a while to review ..oops). Great location and in walking distance of main shopping area. We walked here from train station ( about a 5 min walk). Staff were quiet and unobtrusive which we like. With no lifts and three very heavy bags we had to take it slowly but it didnt seem to matter.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel !

reviews.text: Firstly the location was very good,close to train station and only a minutes walk to Karlsplatz.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel,good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were a good size, clean and had a nice bathroom. Sadly there were no lifts but that wasnt too much of a problem.
reviews.title: Couldn't recommend more A++++

reviews.text: Staff were very pleasant and helpful. The reception was open 24 hours. The breakfast was excellent; lots of meat,cheese,cereals,fruit juices and bread.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel -Very Central!

reviews.text: Would recommend anyone to stay here f
reviews.title: friendly place & good value.

reviews.text: or a good value city break.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: Check in was friendly and fast. No lift, so up two flights of stairs. Room for a single was small, small bed, desk, TV from the 50's or 60's, I think my laptop had a bigger screen, no English channels, free wifi, clean bathroom. Breakfast included in room rate, and was fine. Key must be left at the front desk, no safe in room or at front desk for valuables. Small garden with an area for sitting for those that smoke. Five minute walk from the main rail station. For 55 euros a night you might want to look a little further before selecting this hotel.
reviews.title: Ok for a night or two

reviews.text: I use this hotel for years. It is located just across the Haupbanhof , in a small street in Bayerstrasse. In the center of Munich. Few minutes on foot from the pedestrian zone. Very well managed hotel. Very clean, Confortable rooms, Friendly staff, very good breakfast. The old building has rooms in bavarian color and an old wooden stair. The best rooms are in the second floor in the old building. This time we had a family room, very large. Just perfect. Highly recomented. There is no elevator.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel , Perfect Central Location

reviews.text: The hotel is not situated on a picturesque street but it is very close to the main station and within a walking distance to Marienplatz; therefore its location is very convenient. The room we stayed was a spacious and comfortable one with Bavarian furniture. Breakfast is good.
reviews.title: Very good location and comfortable room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lack of a lift is a problem because the building is five Floors. If you cannot climb, write the hotel beforehand so that they will give you a room on the first floor.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception is helpful, answering all questions.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel in Munich!

reviews.text: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews , and i have to say it is excellent , clean and welcoming. Yes rooms are small and there is no lift but if you aer like us and just use the room to sleep in then choose this hotel you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was great included in the price which was excellent considering its close loaction to the train station and centre.
reviews.title: A Fabulous Traditional B&B in a Modern City

reviews.text: Tip if you are in a group use the train S8 or S1 from the Airport 20 euro for upto 5 people and the ticket is valid until 6am the next day as long as you all travel togeher.
reviews.title: Not for groups....or the unfit!

reviews.text: Munich is a great destination plenty to do and the Beer halls are great
reviews.title: Tidy, basic budget hotel in a good location

reviews.text: If you decide to live in a Traditional European B&B in Munich city close to the train station, then this hotel is definitely for you. Tucked in a small and quiet by lane across from the Train station (approx 300mtrs), you are in a totally ancient backdrop of germany. From the entrance itself, you get the feeling of being in a B&B. I simply loved their restaurant for breakfast which is so beautifully decorated. The rooms are slightly smaller (though I took a Single Bed room) but the all wooden feel simply sets an old world charm. The Breakfast has many options and is very delicious. The service and staff are simply awesome, helping and can speak english. The only unfortunate part is the lack of an elevator. But, if you ignore those 10 minutes of your trip of taking and bringing down the bags upon check-in and check-out, then you are simply in for a fabulous stay. Go for it!!!!
reviews.title: Basic but clean
